comment: C18: French: 3 Nc3 Bb4: Main line: 7 h4 and 7 Qg4

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e5 c5 5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 Qc7
comment: This move is designed to discourage 7. Qg4 when black would play 7... f5.  However, a more modern idea is simply 6... Ne7.  Then if 7. Qg4, then 7... cxd4 is complicated, but OK for black.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e5 c5 5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 Qc7 7. Nf3 Bd7 8. a4 Ne7 9. Bd3 Nbc6 10. O-O c4 11. Be2 f6 12. Ba3 O-O 13. Re1 Rf7 14. exf6 gxf6 15. Bf1 Re8 16. Nh4 Ng6 17. Qh5 Rg7 18. g3 Qa5

comment: The isolated pawn on a4 becomes a target.

comment: White is not prepared to exploit the attacking chances created by this line opening move.  Perhaps this move was a bit impatient.

Bd6 Rh7 49. gxf5 exf5 50. Rh4 Ke6 51. Bh2 Rb2 52. Kd2 Rhb7 53. Kc1 R2b6 54. Bf1 Ng8 55. Bf4 a5
comment: This outside passed pawn will eventually win the game for black in classic style.  The pawn is untouchable 56. Rxa5? Rb1+ grabs the Bishop.

Re1+ Kd6 65. Bh6 a3 66. Bf8+ Kc6 67. Bc5 Ra8 68. Ra1 a2 69. Ke3 Nd6 70. Kf4 Nb5 71. Bb4 h4 72. Bh3 Nc7 73. Be7
comment: White resigns after making this move in adjournment.  There might follow, 73... Re8! (threatening Ne6+) 74. Bxh4 Rh8! (75. Kg3 f4+) 75. Bxf5 Rxh4+ wins a piece for 3 pawns, but white's extra pawns are not enough to turn the tide.
